security_audit.summary: All 636 static findings are false positives. The scanner misidentified LaTeX font commands (e.g., \sf, \bf, \begin{itemize}) as cryptographic algorithms, and markdown code examples as shell execution. The single shell script (review_poster.sh) only runs read-only PDF quality checks on user-specified files with hardcoded commands.

content.value_statement: Research posters are essential for scientific communication at conferences. This skill provides templates and guidance for creating professional academic posters using LaTeX packages like beamerposter, tikzposter, and baposter.
actual_capabilities: Generate LaTeX poster templates for beamerposter, tikzposter, and baposter
Configure poster sizes including A0, A1, and 36x48 inch formats
Apply design principles for typography, color schemes, and visual hierarchy
Create multi-column layouts with proper spacing and alignment
Integrate figures, tables, equations, and QR codes into posters
Review PDF output for quality including font embedding and image resolution
limitations: Does not compile LaTeX documents directly - only provides templates and guidance
Does not generate custom graphics or figures - use scientific-schematics skill for visuals
Does not print or submit posters - only assists with creation and review
Requires LaTeX distribution installed locally for compilation

use_cases.title: Conference poster preparation
use_cases.description: Create academic posters for conferences like NeurIPS, CVPR, or ICML with proper formatting and design

use_cases.title: Department poster templates
use_cases.description: Build branded poster templates for research groups with institutional colors and logos

use_cases.title: Thesis defense visuals
use_cases.description: Design large-format visual presentations for dissertation defenses and symposia

prompt_templates.title: Basic poster generation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a LaTeX research poster template using beamerposter for a conference. The poster should be A0 portrait size with 3 columns. Include sections for Introduction, Methods, Results, and Conclusions.

prompt_templates.title: Custom design specification
prompt_templates.scenario: Design a poster with specific colors
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a tikzposter template with a professional color scheme. Use blue and white colors with high contrast for readability. Configure the poster for 36x48 inch landscape orientation.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-column layout
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a baposter template with 4 columns for a comprehensive research poster. Include placeholders for 5 figures, a QR code linking to a DOI, and institutional branding in the header.

prompt_templates.title: Quality review and optimization
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me review my generated poster PDF. Walk me through checking page size, font embedding, image resolution, and preparing the file for professional printing.

output_examples.input: Create a research poster for a machine learning paper on transformers
output: I'll create a LaTeX poster template for your transformer research. Here are the options:
‚Ä¢ beamerposter: Traditional academic style, familiar Beamer syntax
‚Ä¢ tikzposter: Modern design with TikZ integration and color themes
‚Ä¢ baposter: Structured box-based layout with automatic positioning
For your machine learning topic, I recommend tikzposter for modern aesthetics or beamerposter for traditional academic conferences.
Provide: 1) Poster size (A0 portrait or 36x48 landscape), 2) Your institution's color scheme, 3) Number of main figures (typically 3-5 for ML papers)

best_practices: Use high-resolution figures (300+ DPI) and vector graphics when possible for scalability
Limit total word count to 300-800 words with 40-50% visual content
Test print at 25% scale before final printing to verify readability from distance
anti_patterns: Avoid text-heavy posters with small fonts (under 24pt body text) - viewers cannot read from distance
Do not use red-green color combinations - inaccessible to color-blind viewers
Avoid cluttered layouts with no white space - reduces readability and visual impact

faq.question: What poster sizes are supported?
faq.answer: A0 (841x1189mm), A1 (594x841mm), and North American sizes like 36x48 inches. Portrait and landscape orientations available.

faq.question: Which LaTeX package should I choose?
faq.answer: beamerposter for traditional conferences, tikzposter for modern colorful designs, baposter for structured multi-column layouts.

faq.question: How do I include figures?
faq.answer: Use \includegraphics[width=0.8\linewidth]{figure.pdf}. Ensure images are 300+ DPI and use vector formats (PDF, SVG) when possible.

faq.question: How do I verify my PDF is print-ready?
faq.answer: Run ./scripts/review_poster.sh to check page size, font embedding, and image resolution. Also do a 25% scale test print.

faq.question: Can I add a QR code?
faq.answer: Yes, use \qrcode[height=3cm]{https://doi.org/your-paper} with the qrcode package to link to your paper or supplementary materials.

faq.question: What fonts should I use?
faq.answer: Use sans-serif fonts (Helvetica, Arial) at 72-120pt for title, 48-72pt for headers, and 24-36pt minimum for body text.
